3.subquestion: Now we can answer the question: Simplify $(-k + 4) + (-2 + 3k)$.

subanswer.text: Starting with $(-k + 4) + (-2 + 3k)$, following through steps leads to $[(-k)+4]+((-2)+(3k))=[-(k+2)]+(4+3k)=[(3k)-(k+2)]=(3k)-k-(2)=2k-2]$. Hence, the fully simplified form is indeed $2k-2$.
